name: Tales of Zestiria
summary: Tales of Zestiria is a Japanese role-playing game. It is the fifteenth main entry in the Tales series. As with previous entries in the Tales series, the game uses a variation of the action-based Linear Motion Battle System, with additional elements including a navigable open world, and the ability for certain characters to fuse into a single entity in battle to deliver powerful attacks. The story follows Sorey, a young man blessed with powers by a mystical spirit race known as the Seraphim who act as a stabilizing force in the land, as he travels to free the land of Glenwood from the threat of the Hellion, creatures spawned by negative emotions.

alternative_names.name: テイルズ オブ ゼスティリア

esrb.synopsis: This is a role-playing game in which players assume the role of a warrior (Sorey) who attempts to defeat an evil lord. Players explore towns and fields, interact with citizens, and battle enemies in fast-paced, melee-style combat. Players use swords, lances, pistols, and elemental attacks to defeat humans and fantasy creatures (i.e., spider-like creatures, blobs, werewolves). Battles are highlighted by gunfire, impact sounds, and cries of pain. Cutscenes also depict violence, and on occasion, blood: soldiers slashed and stabbed when armies clash; a man impaled by a sword, with blood on his chest. During the course of the game, two characters shoot themselves in the head in order to charge an energy attack. The game includes some suggestive content: female characters wearing outfits that reveal moderate amounts of cleavage; topless creatures with hair or spider webs barely covering their breasts. Characters make occasional references to alcohol in the dialogue: “I highly recommend Rolance ale and whiskey”; “Happy beer is best beer!” Two characters are briefly depicted smoking pipes. The words “a*s” and “bastard” appear in dialogue.
